intro: Rosa × hibernica var. grovesii, commonly known as the Grovesii rose, is a hybrid shrub native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dark green, leathery foliage. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardiness in temperate climates. This variety is well-suited for gardens and can thrive in partial shade to full sun.
